text: you want a great way to keep summer
around all year long why not try making
this late summer vegetable soup and then
freezing some for the middle of winter
when you're really craving those summer
flavors start off by removing the
kernels from four ears of really great
corn so good at this time of year you
also want to have 8 ounces of green
beans I like to line up my green beans
so that all the stems are going in one
direction and then just chop them all
off at once and then the green beans
need to be cut into thirds I like to
leave the little pointy ends on but if
that's something that you don't enjoy
eating not everybody likes them you can
remove them and they can go right into
the bowl with the corn because all the
vegetables are going to go into the soup
at the same time over here I have a
large pot on a medium medium-high heat
add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and then
1 onion diced cook your onion until it's
translucent you can add some salt and
pepper at this point
kind of amazing what a difference just a
little bit of sauteing will do for
onions and garlic's and other aromatics
like that really brings out the
sweetness and softens them just a little
bit so they meld better with all the
dishes that they used in when the onions
are translucent you can add two cans of
low-sodium chicken broth if you want
your soup to be vegetarian you can use
vegetable broth that's fine I do like
the flavor of chicken broth and
vegetable soup but I certainly
understand that vegetarians would not
want to do that 2 cups of water when
your liquids come to a boil you can add
all your veg the corn the green beans a
14 and a half ounce can of diced
tomatoes with their juice 2 zucchini
that have been cut in half and then into
half moons and then 1/2 a cup of orzo
everything goes in all at once
stir it together return it to a boil now
that the soups at a boil just reduced it
to like a medium simmer and cook it
until vegetables are tender and the orzo
is cooked through about 8 minutes all
right look at that beautiful the orzo is
just cooked and I'm going to turn it off
just remember if you are freezing this
and you defrost it everything gets
softer so don't overcook anything right
now give it a taste mmm corn still a
little bit crunchy which is fantastic a
little bit of salt pepper I think it
needs quite a bit of pepper there's all
those vegetables in there are really
sweet especially the corn give it a stir
serve some up to yourself now as a
special treat and then freeze some up
for cold winter's night when all you
want is just a little bit of summer
they'll be happy you did
